intro: Pedrosia tenella, commonly known as the slender pedrosia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces achenes as its fruit. Pedrosia tenella is often found in coastal and arid regions, where it displays adaptations to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
